georgie.description:
Georgie, a school friend, came for a sleepover. She made herself right at home. It was fun!
Later in the week, Felix spent a night at Sofia's, another school friend. We've been doing lots of sleepovers because everybody wins: the kids have a great time and learn about other families' habits and rituals; it's fun for one set of parents to have an extra kid for a day; and the other set of parents get a night off.
georgie.title: Georgie

hall_of_science.description: The Lawrence Hall of Science, high above Berkeley. They have dinosaurs that move. Milo's scared of them.
hall_of_science.title: Hall Of Science

keyboard0.description: Brian, a friend, gave us his old keyboard.
keyboard0.title: Keyboard

keyboard1.description: The keyboard has a demo mode that plays rock music.  Milo dances like mad to it.
keyboard1.title: Keyboard 1

lettuce.description: We discovered that Milo has a very rare taste for a baby:  lettuce! He loves it, tossed in a light vinaigrette.
lettuce.title: Lettuce

park1.description: Adventure Playground, the park SO dangerous and SO fun that you have to sign a liability waiver to get in.    So far we've managed to not get crushed, maimed, punctured or mauled.
park1.title: Park 1

park2.description: Everyone looks more beautiful when they're in the Boat O' Color.
park2.title: Park 2

park3.description: Milo doesn't usually get frustrated, but he's been a little off this week.  Teething.
park3.title: Park 3

park4.description: King Dean and Prince Milo wave to their loyal subjects.
park4.title: Park 4

park6.description: Milo still hasn't much sense of personal safety.   He wanted to take off his clothes and go swimming.
park6.title: Park 6

pottery1.description: The following photos were taken a few weeks ago. Ehren Tool generously invited Felix and another child to come play in his pottery studio on the UC campus. Ehren's son, Argil, is a pal of Milo's.
pottery1.title: Pottery 1

pottery2.description: Felix knew exactly what he wanted to make: a spaceship for Baby Dog.
pottery2.title: Pottery 2

pottery3.description: Lucie had just as much fun as Felix. Using a pottery wheel is tricky but, with a little help from Ehren, a water dish for Baby Dog was succesfully engineered.
pottery3.title: Pottery 3

pottery4.description: Et voilà! All fired up and glazed.
pottery4.title: Pottery 4

soccer.description:
Milo's getting better and better at soccer. He's a great dribbler.
In the background is one of Berkeley's skate and bike parks. Where were these when Dean was a kid?!
soccer.title: Soccer

description:
One day a week, Milo stays with a spanish-speaking nanny, Lucy. We've recently realized that Milo actually understands some Spanish! For example, if you ask him "¿donde esta tu mano?", he correctly shows you his hand. Lucy reports that Milo understands everything she says. Also, we are pretty sure he says "aqua" sometimes (though he still favors the baby sign for water).

Felix is learning a little spanish as well. One of his main teacher, Alfonso, is from Peru, and has been giving Spanish lessons to the kids. Felix is fascinated with the concept of foreign countries, with their different languages and customs. He remembers his trip to France very well, and wants to go back. Also, he says he wants to go to Mexico. Felix's favorite afternoon teacher, Gabriel, just came back from a 3 months trip to Mexico; he and Felix have been swapping travelling stories.

Felix says that when he grows up, he wants to be a teacher at his school. He's got it all figured out: "I'll still live here with you guys, except I'll be grown up, so I can to walk to school all by myself."
title: March 5
